text: Is there a way to create a blog page with filters ?
Im a new dev on the team so im not sure how I would start. Our client has blog posts , and want a page that can filter between different category types

Yes, we work on blog listing pages with category filters quite a bitâ€“ but it takes some extra pieces that don't automatically come along with HubSpot

The way we set it up is with a custom module having a HubDB row selector applied as a static module to the Blog Post template.

This way you can select a HubDB row (in the context of the blog post) which helps add a chunk of data to the post details you can access in the listing template context via `content.widgets['Name-of-Module-Referenced-In-Template'].body.reference_to_field_in_custom_module.id`

Keeping the category configuration with a HubDB helps the client to control the available categories for a blog.

Then we create a blog listing module that loads all of the categories (in the HubDB) as filter buttons, and apply filter functionality to the listing page using URL params and javascript rendering of the posts into the listing page. Here's an example of that: <https://www.komodohealth.com/perspectives>
You can also do all of the filtering with HubL if you want to avoid the added javascript handling, here's an example that uses HubL filtering to achieve the same thing <https://resilience.com/news>
